reporter_caption.center: IN RE MARRIAGE OF CLONTS, 85 S.W.3d 702 (Mo.App.E.D. 2002)

caption.center: In re the Marriage of CHARLES EUGENE CLONTS, JR., Petitioner/Appellant,

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Circuit Court of Franklin County; Joseph M. Ladd, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
Daniel E. Leslie, Joseph Aubuchon, Union, MO, for appellant.
Jonathan L. Downard, Union, MO, for respondent.
opinion.panel: Before Mary R. Russell, P.J., Clifford H. Ahrens, J., and James R. Dowd, J.Page 703
opinion.opinion_text:
Charles E. Clonts, Jr. appeals from the judgment of the Circuit Court of Franklin County dissolving his marriage to Jill M. Clonts ("wife"), dividing the marital property in favor of wife, and awarding child support, maintenance, and attorney fees to wife.
We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal and find no error of law. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum opinion for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.
The judgment of the trial court is affirmed in accordance with Rule 84.16(b).
